title: Game Start Transitions from IDLE to PLAYING
description: Verify that starting a new game changes the game state from IDLE to PLAYING and the UI updates accordingly.

steps.description: Load the main game page.
Verify the initial game state is IDLE.
Trigger the start game command.
Confirm the game state changes to PLAYING.
Verify UI overlays update to reflect active gameplay state.

title: Tetromino Spawn Position and Initial State
description: Check that tetromino pieces spawn at the top center of the board in their default orientation.

steps.description: Start a new game.
Verify the first tetromino spawns at the top center grid position.
Verify the tetromino is in its default rotation state.

title: Tetromino Keyboard Control: Move Left
description: Validate that pressing the left arrow key moves the current tetromino piece left by one column if no collision occurs.

steps.description: Start a new game with piece spawned.
Press the left arrow key once.
Verify the piece moves one column to the left if the position is valid.
Attempt to move left at the left boundary repeatedly.
Verify piece does not move outside the left board boundary.

title: Tetromino Keyboard Control: Move Right
description: Validate that pressing the right arrow key moves the current tetromino piece right by one column if no collision occurs.

steps.description: Start a new game with piece spawned.
Press the right arrow key once.
Verify the piece moves one column to the right if the position is valid.
Attempt to move right at the right boundary repeatedly.
Verify piece does not move outside the right board boundary.

title: Tetromino Rotation Input and Collision Detection
description: Ensure tetromino rotates correctly on valid rotation keys and does not rotate into blocked or out-of-bound positions.

steps.description: Start a new game with piece spawned.
Press the rotate key (e.g., up arrow or designated key).
Verify the tetromino rotates 90 degrees clockwise.
Attempt rotation near the left wall.
Rotation is allowed only if the resulting position is within bounds and not colliding.
Attempt rotation that would collide with locked blocks.
Block rotation is prevented and the tetromino remains in current orientation.

title: Soft Drop Functionality
description: Validate the piece moves down faster while soft drop key is pressed, respecting collision and boundaries.

steps.description: Start a new game with piece spawned.
Press and hold the soft drop key.
Verify the piece moves downward at an accelerated rate.
Release the soft drop key.
Verify the piece drops at normal gravity rate.
Use soft drop when the piece is directly above locked blocks.
Piece stops moving down without overlapping locked blocks.

title: Hard Drop Functionality
description: Ensure pressing hard drop instantly places tetromino at the lowest possible position and locks it.

steps.description: Start a new game with piece spawned.
Press the hard drop key.
Verify the piece immediately moves to the lowest available valid row.
Piece locks in place and triggers line clearing if appropriate.

title: Line Clearing and Score Update
description: Validate that completing a line causes it to clear properly, the score updates correctly, and UI reflects those changes.

steps.description: Start a new game and arrange blocks to complete one or multiple lines.
Lock piece completing the line(s).
Verify the completed line(s) clear from the board.
Confirm score, lines cleared, and level update accordingly in the Zustand store.
UI overlays update instantly reflecting new score and lines.

title: Game Over State Transition
description: Validate game transitions to GAME OVER state when new pieces cannot spawn, and UI updates accordingly.

steps.description: Fill the board to leave no space for new tetromino spawn.
Lock piece and trigger spawn attempt for next piece.
Verify the game state transitions to GAME OVER.
Verify UI shows Game Over screen with options to restart or pause.

title: Pause and Resume Functionality
description: Ensure the game can be paused and resumed seamlessly with correct UI updates and game state preservation.

steps.description: Start a game and begin playing.
Trigger pause command.
Verify game logic halts and UI shows paused state.
Trigger resume command.
Verify game resumes from paused state without losing progress.

title: Hold Queue Functionality
description: Validate holding a piece removes it from current play and stores it, with restrictions on subsequent holds in the same drop.

steps.description: Start a new game and allow a piece to spawn.
Press the hold key to store the active piece.
Verify the held piece is stored and the next piece spawns.
Attempt to hold again before locking current piece.
Verify holding is disallowed until piece locks.

title: Next Piece Queue Display
description: Verify that the queue of next upcoming pieces is displayed and updated correctly as pieces spawn.

steps.description: Start a game.
Verify next pieces queue displays correctly on UI.
Lock a piece and observe next piece spawning.
Verify next pieces queue updates accordingly.

title: Canvas Rendering at 60 FPS
description: Ensure the game board canvas renders smoothly at 60 FPS without graphical glitches during gameplay.

steps.description: Start a game and observe gameplay.
Verify the canvas updates smoothly at approx. 60 frames per second.
Ensure no graphical artifacts or flickering occur.

title: Background Image Transitions
description: Validate that background images switch smoothly between day and night Gwanghwamun scenes based on game level.

steps.description: Start a game and progress levels incrementally.
Verify background transitions smoothly from day to night scenes at specified level thresholds.
Ensure transitions do not disrupt gameplay or cause visible glitches.

title: Visual Styling Conformance
description: Check that all visual elements including Hanok-style frames, Obangsaek neon glow for tetrominoes, and traditional Korean patterns are displayed as specified.

steps.description: Load the main game page.
Verify Hanok-style framing around the game board is present and styled properly.
Confirm tetromino blocks are rendered with Neon Glow using Obangsaek color scheme.
Check presence of traditional Korean pattern overlays if any.

title: Audio Playback for Background Music
description: Ensure background music loops continuously with traditional Korean instrument sounds blended with modern beats.

steps.description: Start a game.
Verify background music starts playing automatically.
Confirm music loops seamlessly.
Verify traditional Korean instrument sounds and modern beats are audibly layered.

title: Audio Playback of Sound Effects
description: Validate that sound effects for piece rotations, drops, and line clears play correctly and synchronously with game events.

steps.description: Start a game.
Rotate pieces multiple times.
Verify rotation sound effects play on each valid rotation.
Soft drop and hard drop pieces.
Confirm drop sound effects play accordingly.
Clear lines by locking pieces.
Confirm clearing line sound effects play on correct events.

title: Game State Management Accuracy via Zustand
description: Verify that the Zustand store accurately reflects real-time score, level, lines cleared, hold piece, and game status changes.

steps.description: Start a new game.
Verify initial Zustand store values for score, level, lines, hold piece, and status.
Play through game events such as piece movement, locking, line clearing, and holding pieces.
Continuously verify the Zustand store updates correctly reflecting those game states.

title: Error Handling: Invalid Keyboard Inputs
description: Verify that invalid or unsupported keyboard inputs are ignored and do not affect game state or cause errors.

steps.description: Start a game.
Press unsupported keys or random keypresses.
Confirm no game state changes or crashes occur.
Verify UI and game logic continue functioning normally.

title: Edge Case: Rotation at Board Corners
description: Test tetromino rotations at the corners and edges of the game board to ensure correct collision detection and no glitches.

steps.description: Start a game and move tetromino to each corner and edge.
Attempt rotations at those positions.
Verify rotations only occur if no collision and stays within bounds.
Check no visual glitches or off-board rendering.
